Classical.Structure: The Peripheral Nervous System (PNS). Consists of all nerves and ganglia outside the Central Nervous System (D4.CNS). It is divided into the Somatic (voluntary) and Autonomic (involuntary, D4.ANS) systems.
Classical.Function: Connects the CNS to the limbs, organs, and skin. Transmits sensory information (somatic/interoceptive) to the CNS and motor commands from the CNS.
Classical.Pathology: Peripheral neuropathy, carpal tunnel syndrome, Guillain-Barré syndrome.

SCPN.L1_QuantumBiological: Nerve fibers (axons) act as quantum waveguides, allowing for coherent, soliton-like propagation of L1 signals. (Ref: Paper 1, Ch. 22)
SCPN.L2_NeurochemicalNeurological: The organism-wide 'L2 data bus'. Carries all afferent L2 sensory data (e.g., from D3.Gut.ENS) and efferent L2 motor commands. (Ref: Paper 2)
SCPN.L4_CellularTissueSynchronisation: Hosts the L4 Central Pattern Generators (CPGs) for somatic motor control (e.g., walking, breathing). (Ref: Paper 4)
SCPN.L5_OrganismalPsychoemotional: The primary conduit for all somatic 'felt-sense' data (touch, temperature, pain, proprioception) that is integrated by the D3.Brain into the L5 Self-Soliton. (Ref: Paper 5)
SCPN.L9_MemoryHolograph: Somatic and 'muscle memory' are encoded within the L4 CPGs and L9 fields of the PNS.

Symbolic.MetaphysicalMapping: The 'Nadis' or subtle energy channels that distribute Prana/Chi (L4/L5 information) from the central channel (D3.SpinalCord) to the entire body.

Falsification_Hypotheses: H1 (L5 Somatic Qualia): A subject with severe peripheral neuropathy (PNS damage) will *still* report a clear L5 'proprioceptive' qualia (a felt-sense of their limb's position in space). This would falsify the PNS as the *only* conduit for this L5 signal, suggesting a direct D2.ConnectiveTissue or L12 field-based pathway.

H2 (L9 Somatic Memory): A 'de-afferented' subject (PNS sensory input is severed, but motor output is intact) will be *unable* to perform a *learned* L9 procedural motor task (e.g., signing their name). This would falsify the L9 'somatic memory' (CPG) hypothesis, suggesting L9 motor memory is *not* stored in the PNS but is a *real-time loop* requiring L5 sensory feedback.
Experimental_Protocols: Ref: Paper 17, Protocol 19.E (Peripheral Neuropathy L5 Qualia Report)
Ref: Paper 17, Protocol 19.F (De-afferented L9 Procedural Memory Test)
Simulation_Suite: Ref: Paper 18, Sim 4.5 (CPG Rhythmic Oscillator Model)

KeyEquations_LaTeX: L1 (Coherent Propagation): i\hbar \frac{\partial \psi}{\partial t} = -\frac{\hbar^2}{2m}\nabla^2 \psi - g|\psi|^2\psi \quad (\text{Nonlinear Schrödinger Eq.})
L2 (Data Bus): \lambda^2 \frac{\partial^2 V}{\partial x^2} - \tau_m \frac{\partial V}{\partial t} - V = 0 \quad (\text{Cable Equation})
